words.fact: Consistency requires using the same accounting methods from period to period. This allows stakeholders to compare financial statements across different time periods.
Materiality means information should be disclosed if it could influence economic decisions of users. Immaterial items can be treated in a simpler, more cost-effective way.
Relevance ensures financial information is capable of making a difference in decisions. Information must be timely and have predictive or confirmatory value.
Reliability means financial information must be verifiable, neutral, and faithfully represent economic reality. Users must be able to depend on the information being accurate.
